story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does West Coast Gravel land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race West Coast Gravel? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. West Coast Gravel scored 43 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race West Coast Gravel?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: West Coast Gravel. Yachats, OR. 55 mi. Oregon coast gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: West Coast Gravel | Yachats, OR | 55 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Requires line choice. Rewards the attentive rider. The course features "terrain new to many riders with a thrilling twist that has seldom seen a bike tire on" through Siuslaw National Forest backroads. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. Starting from sea-level Yachats and climbing inland through forest terrain delivers substantial elevation change, with community reports mentioning 5000 feet total. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Adventure factor is real. The course delivers "ocean waves and ribbons of gravel" through Siuslaw National Forest on routes that have "seldom seen a bike tire. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. The package includes custom medals, $14 food vouchers, fully stocked aid stations with Hammer Nutrition products, and drop bag service. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. Packet pickup ends at 8:30 AM for a 9:00 AM start, creating stress for mechanical issues. Length. 2 out of 5. Manageable distance. Back by lunch. Elite winner Austen Davis finished Erik the Red in 2:42:39, while the short course winner clocked 1:38:21. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Organizers report "great weather 75% of the time" over the past decade, but warn "Always bring good rain gear when visiting the Oregon Coast!
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Experience. 2 out of 5. Fine. Just fine. Community. 2 out of 5. Polite. Not exactly warm. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Under the radar. Completely unknown. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Small field. You might podium by showing up.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: What West Coast Gravel does well.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.narration: What they don't put on the website.
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Yachats has limited lodging. Plan ahead.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Oregon Coast Gravel. If you're local to OR. yes, it's solid. If you're traveling. skip it.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If West Coast Gravel isn't quite right for you. For better OR races: Oregon Coast Gravel Epic, Oregon Gran Fondo.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced West Coast Gravel? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'West Coast Gravel' bold text, tier badge 'GRASSROOTS', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.

production_checklist: [ ] B-roll sourced (check broll_sources in each beat)
[ ] Music track selected (check BPM targets per beat)
